concept.title: Topic type module coding requirements
concept.shortdesc: Topic type vocabulary modules must conform to additional coding requirements for defining default topic nesting.

section.title: Default nested topics entity
section.p: A topic type module must define an entity to specify default subordinate topics. The entity name must be the topic element name plus the -info-types suffix. For example, the info-types entity for the concept topic is concept-info-types. If the topic has default subordinate topics, this entity can default to a list of element entities. If not, the entity can default to the value of the info-types entity as in the following example:

A document type shell can then control how topics are allowed to nest by redefining the topictype-info-types entity for each topic type, or it can efficiently create common nesting rules by redefining the main info-types entity.
